comment:
* A virtual navigation touchpad representing a touch-based input mechanism on a remote device. * *

This registers an InputDevice that is interpreted like a physically-connected device and * dispatches received events to it. * *

The virtual touchpad will be in navigation mode. Motion results in focus traversal in the same * manner as D-Pad navigation if the events are not consumed. * * @see android.view.InputDevice#SOURCE_TOUCH_NAVIGATION * * @hide

methods.name: public void sendTouchEvent(@NonNull VirtualTouchEvent event)
methods.comment:
* Sends a touch event to the system.
     *
     * @param event the event to send
